message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "This study utilizes data from the World Bank Enterprise Surveys conducted in the period 2014-2020 to examine the relationship between export status and productivity of firms across sub-Saharan African countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Trade", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "To explore the impact of extractive industries on local economic development, we use a geocoded dataset of all mining projects in Africa since the late 1990s, matched with high-resolution satellite imagery of nighttime light emissions.", "dataset": ["geocoded dataset of all mining projects in Africa since the late 1990s", "high-resolution satellite imagery of nighttime light emissions"], "topic": ["Extractive Industries", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "We utilize international trade data on tariff rates and non-tariff measures (NTMs) from the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD), complemented by information on domestic factors like market access and infrastructure quality to explain asymmetries in bilateral trade flows between developed and developing countries.", "dataset": ["United Nations Conference on Trade and Development (UNCTAD)"], "topic": ["Trade", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "Using household surveys from the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) Program in Nigeria, Ethiopia, and Bangladesh, we investigate the socioeconomic determinants of child malnutrition in these countries.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) Program"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "To examine how access to credit affects rural households' agricultural production in developing countries, we combine household survey data from the Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA) with information on proximity to mobile money agents in this area.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "We use electricity billing records from the Kenya Power and Lighting Company (KPLC), combined with high-frequency satellite data on nighttime light intensity, to estimate the causal impact of electrification on local economic activity in rural areas of Kenya.", "dataset": ["Kenya Power and Lighting Company (KPLC)"], "topic": ["Energy", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "In this study, we examine the effect of climate change on food security in sub-Saharan African countries, using temperature and precipitation data from the Climatic Research Unit (CRU) and crop yield data from the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO).", "dataset": ["Climatic Research Unit (CRU)", "Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO)"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "To investigate the determinants of women's political representation in developing countries, we use a comparative dataset of women's political presence across countries from the Inter-Parliamentary Union (IPU), combined with information on national policy frameworks enhancing gender equality from the World Bank Gender Data Portal.", "dataset": ["Inter-Parliamentary Union (IPU)", "World Bank Gender Data Portal"], "topic": ["Gender", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "This paper draws upon two datasets to examine access to financial services for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region: the 2019 SME Finance Survey conducted by the Union of Arab Banks (UAB) and the Global Findex survey conducted by the World Bank Group.", "dataset": ["2019 SME Finance Survey conducted by the Union of Arab Banks (UAB)", "Global Findex survey conducted by the World Bank Group"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "Using a panel dataset of 77 countries from the World Bank's Doing Business report, we investigate the role of institutions in creating an environment that fosters entrepreneurship and innovation.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Doing Business report"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "We leverage data from multiple sources to construct a comprehensive index of social and economic vulnerability to climate-related hazards in coastal cities in Asia and the Pacific region, including information on urbanization trends, exposure to natural disasters, and socioeconomic indicators from the Asian Development Bank's (ADB) City Resilience Index, the International Disaster Database (EM-DAT), and the United Nations Human Settlements Programme (UN-Habitat).", "dataset": ["Asian Development Bank's (ADB) City Resilience Index", "International Disaster Database (EM-DAT)", "United Nations Human Settlements Programme (UN-Habitat)"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Urban Development"]}]
